thread.title: Ground News - Body cam footage shows NYPD officers rescue man on subway tracks
thread.title_full: Ground News - Body cam footage shows NYPD officers rescue man on subway tracks

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Body cam footage shows NYPD officers rescue man on subway tracks
text:
Summary by Ground News Officers Garcia and Mohan were conducting an inspection on the Carroll Street subway station in Brooklyn when they saw a man fall onto the roadbed. Body-worn camera footage shows the moment the officers reacted to the man's fall and their swift moves to help him back onto the platform. These same officers were involved in a rescue that took place on October 3, where a woman became trapped beneath a pier in Red Hook. Share menu More
Filters 2 Articles 2 Articles All Left Center Right
PIX 11 Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Mission Broadcasting NYPD officers rescue man who fell onto subway tracks; second dramatic rescue this year BROOKLYN, N.Y. (PIX11) – Two officers saved a man who fell onto the subway tracks in Brooklyn on Tuesday, video shows. Officers Garcia and Mohan were inspecting the Carroll Street subway station in Brooklyn when they saw a man fall onto the tracks, police said. NYC street closures for Times Square ball drop on New Year’s Eve They quickly made their way to help the man, the video shows. One of the officers jumped onto the tracks to help…
